author: jvanzyl
msg: o Allow project to track the paths to individual dependencies.

author: jvanzyl
msg: o A new bean that deals with creating the dependency classpath for a
project taking into consideration the maven.jar.override option.
This is now used to create the maven.dependency.classpath and additionally
it will populate a map in the project that stores the individual paths
for each dependency. So in your maven.xml files you can use something like:
This new bean is also used in the PluginManager strictly for providing
the paths for each of the dependencies. So in a plugin.jelly script
the plugin project is now available as ${plugin} and you can do the
The impetus for these changes came from Vincent trying to get the
aspectj plugin working where the path to specific aspectj jars were
required in order to access the aspectj compiler.
